alert.note: Alert for Buchanan (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 2:47PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Thunderstorms producing heavy rain will impact portions of Buchanan County through 330 PM CDT... At 245 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of showers and thunderstorms near Independence. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and torrential rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Rowley and Brandon. This includes Interstate 380 between mile markers 49 and 55. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
